intro: Rulingia salviifolia, commonly known as the New Zealand native tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Proteaceae. It is native to New Zealand and is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and showy, yellowish-orange inflorescences. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and lowland areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely distributed outside its native range.
